definition: to be drawn into/to be involved in
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: He also became embroiled in controversy surrounding the government bail-out of Chrysler.
sentences.chinese: 同时他也因政府保释克莱斯勒而被卷入巨大争议。

sentences.english: He embroiled himself in their argument.
sentences.chinese: 他使自己卷入了他们的争论。

sentences.english: They involved the purchase of cable television stations.
sentences.chinese: 他们卷入了购买有线电视台的问题。

sentences.english: The swordfish got entangled in the fishing net.
sentences.chinese: 箭鱼被捕鱼网给卷入了。

sentences.english: Arbeloa and Pedro were involved in another incident.
sentences.chinese: 阿贝罗阿和佩德罗同样被卷入另一起纠纷。

sentences.english: When others interfere in the affair, it always makes troubles.
sentences.chinese: 别人一卷入这一事件，棘手的事情就来了。

sentences.english: The devout Christian who led his country into four wars.
sentences.chinese: 正是这位虔诚的基督徒将英国卷入了四场战争。

sentences.english: The cure for triangulation is trust and intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 互相信任与亲密无间是根治第三方卷入的良方。

sentences.english: Out of need and greed, they find themselves caught up in something much bigger than them.
sentences.chinese: 出需要和贪婪，他们发现自己卷入了一场更大的阴谋。

sentences.english: The scandal he was involved in before detracts his from great glorious.
sentences.chinese: 他以往卷入的那件丑问已使他的光辉业绩大为失色。

sentences.english: The revolt had enveloped everything in its smoke.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱把一切都卷入了它的烟雾。

sentences.english: Currently, quantum information is transmitted by connecting, or entangling, qubits.
sentences.chinese: 目前，量子信息是通过链接或者卷入量子位来传输。

sentences.english: He turned them in to the police for being involved in the riot.
sentences.chinese: 他向警方告发他们卷入了暴乱。

sentences.english: I do not like to force the issue. I prefer to talk.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想强迫卷入这个事件中，我只能这样说。

sentences.english: They want India and Pakistan to go to war.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望印度和巴基斯坦卷入战争中。

sentences.english: They were tangled in the labour-management controversy.
sentences.chinese: 他们被卷入了劳资纠纷。

definition: sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable/item sold at a loss
to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
